intro: Cussambium glabrum, commonly known as the smooth cussambium, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its smooth, glabrous stems and lance-shaped leaves. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
